ignore.reason: There are many instances of two adjacent footnotes from different sources, e.g. author and editor; these need to be separated by a space for readability.
There are valid double-spaces in the formatted portion of the production notes.
The ibids are only used for references within the same endnote.
The abbreviations represent the actual printing on a medallion, and therefore need to stay as is.
Citations are for bracketed portion only, and therefore do not have cite tag, which is reserved for an endnote as a whole.
These instances are referring to the novel of Apuleius, not the poem of Ovid.
The sentence in quotes is just a portion of the entire quote, and so the tags are outside the quote marks.
The Roman numeral isnâ€™t a regnal.
